frisch.notes: See Altonji (JPE, 1996) and Peterman (Econ Inquiry, 2016) for estimates of the Frisch elasticity

g_y_annual.long_name: Exogenous growth rate of labor augmenting technological change
g_y_annual.description: Growth rate of labor augmenting technological change

S.long_name: Maximum number of periods of economic life of model agent
S.description: Maximum number of periods of economic life of model agent

J.long_name: Number of different labor productivity types of agents
J.description: Number of different labor productivity types of agents

T.long_name: Number of periods until it is assumed that the model reaches its steady state
T.description: Number of periods until it is assumed that the model reaches its steady state

lambdas.long_name: Fraction of population of each labor productivity type
lambdas.description: Fraction of population of each labor productivity type

starting_age.long_name: Age at which households become economically active
starting_age.description: Age at which households become economically active

ending_age.long_name: Maximum age a household can live until
ending_age.description: Maximum age a household can live until

constant_demographics.notes: This boolean allows one to use empirical mortality rates, but keep the population distribution constant across periods.  Note that immigration is shut off when this is true.

beta_annual.long_name: Annual rate of time preference for households
beta_annual.description: Annual rate of time preference for households

sigma.long_name: Coefficient of relative risk aversion in household utility function
sigma.description: Coefficient of relative risk aversion in household utility function
sigma.notes: Default value from Attanasio, Banks, Meghir and Weber (JEBS, 1999)

gamma_s.long_name: Bond's share of assets in the household portfolio problem
gamma_s.description: Bond's share of assets in the household portfolio problem

epsilon_s.long_name: Elasticity of substitution between bonds and equity in the household portfolio problem
epsilon_s.description: Elasticity of substitution between bonds and equity in the household portfolio problem

gamma.long_name: Capital's share of output in firm production funtion
gamma.description: Capital's share of output in firm production funtion
gamma.notes: Histroical value in U.S. is about 0.33, but Elsby, Hobijn, and Sahin (BPEA, 2013) find capital's share is increasing, so default value is above this

epsilon.long_name: Elasticity of substitution between capital and labor in firm production function
epsilon.description: Elasticity of substitution between capital and labor in firm production function
epsilon.notes: If epislon=1, then production function is Cobb-Douglas.  If epislon=0, then production function is perfect substitutes.

Z.long_name: Total factor productivity in firm production function
Z.description: Total factor productivity in firm production function

delta_annual.long_name: Annual rate of economic depreciation of capital
delta_annual.description: Annual rate of economic depreciation of capital
delta_annual.notes: Approximately the value from Kehoe calibration exercise: http://www.econ.umn.edu/~tkehoe/classes/calibration-04.pdf

ltilde.notes: Can be normalized to 1.0 without loss of generality

small_open.long_name: Boolean to indicate using a small open economy model
small_open.description: Boolean to indicate using a small open economy model

world_int_rate.long_name: Exogenous annual world interest rate to be used when modeling a small open economy
world_int_rate.description: Exogenous annual world interest rate to be used when modeling a small open economy

initial_foreign_debt_ratio.long_name: Share of government debt held by foreigners in model start year
initial_foreign_debt_ratio.description: Share of government debt held by foreigners in model start year

zeta_D.long_name: Share of new debt issues from government that are purchased by foreigners
zeta_D.description: Share of new debt issues from government that are purchased by foreigners

zeta_K.long_name: Share of excess demand for capital that is supplied by foreingers
zeta_K.description: Share of excess demand for capital that is supplied by foreingers

tG1.long_name: Number of model periods until budget closure rule kicks in
tG1.description: Number of model periods until budget closure rule kicks in
tG1.notes: It may make sense for this tG1 to exceed the length of the budget window one is looking at.  But it must also not be too late into the time path that a steady-state won't be reached by time T.

tG2.long_name: Number of model periods until budget closure ends and budgetary variables jump to steady-state values
tG2.description: Number of model periods until budget closure ends and budgetary variables jump to steady-state values
tG2.notes: The number of periods until the closure rule ends must not exceed T, the time at which the model is assumed to reach the steady-state.

alpha_T.long_name: Exogenous ratio of government transfers to GDP when budget balance is false.
alpha_T.description: Exogenous ratio of government transfers to GDP when budget balance is false.

alpha_G.long_name: Exogenous ratio of government spending to GDP when budget balance is false.
alpha_G.description: Exogenous ratio of government spending to GDP when budget balance is false.

rho_G.long_name: Speed of convergence to a stable government budget deficit for periods [tG1, tG2-1]
rho_G.description: Speed of convergence to a stable government budget deficit for periods [tG1, tG2-1]

debt_ratio_ss.long_name: Debt to GDP ratio to be achieved in the steady state
debt_ratio_ss.description: Debt to GDP ratio to be achieved in the steady state
debt_ratio_ss.notes: Note that depending upon the tax policy parameters, some debt to GDP ratios may not be achievable with positive government spending

initial_debt_ratio.long_name: Debt to GDP ratio in the initial period
initial_debt_ratio.description: Debt to GDP ratio in the initial period
initial_debt_ratio.notes: Should be calibrated based on government debt held by the public to GDP in the model start year.

r_gov_scale.long_name: Scale parameter to determine government interest rate.
r_gov_scale.description: Parameter to scale the market interest rate to find interest rate on government debt.

r_gov_shift.long_name: Shift parameter to determine government interest rate.
r_gov_shift.description: Parameter to shift the market interest rate to find interest rate on government debt.

tau_b.notes: With a single representative firm, this should be a weighted average of the entity level rate on pass-through businesses (0) and the corporate income tax rate.  It does not reflect statutory rates, but rather effective rates.

tau_c.notes: This policy parameter represents the effective consumption tax rate from sales taxes, VATs, and excise taxes.  To capture exemptions of certain goods, this is assumed to vary by age and ability type.  It is thus a SxJ matrix.

delta_tau_annual.long_name: Annual rate of depreciation of capital for tax purposes
delta_tau_annual.description: Annual rate of depreciation of capital for tax purposes
delta_tau_annual.notes: B-Tax can help to calibrate this parameter

m_wealth.long_name: Term in denominator in wealth tax function
m_wealth.description: Term in denominator in wealth tax function

p_wealth.long_name: Scale parameter in wealth tax function
p_wealth.description: Scale parameter in wealth tax function
p_wealth.notes: Set to 0 to have no wealth tax

tau_payroll.notes: Set to zero as default since tax functions include income and payroll taxes

eta.description: Matrix that allocated government transfers across households.
eta.notes: This SxJ matrix gives the fraction of total aggregate transfers going to each age s and ability type j.

zeta.description: Matrix that describes the bequest distribution process.
zeta.notes: This SxJ matrix gives the fraction of total aggregate bequests going to each age s and ability type j.

use_zeta.long_name: Indicator variable for whether or not to use the zeta matrix to distribute bequests
use_zeta.description: Indicator variable for whether or not to use the zeta matrix to distribute bequests.

chi_n_80.long_name: Utility weight on disutility of labor supply
chi_n_80.description: Household utility weight on on disutility of labor supply

constant_rates.long_name: Flag to use linear tax functions
constant_rates.description: Flag to use linear tax functions

zero_taxes.long_name: Flag to run model without any individual income taxes.
zero_taxes.description: Flag to run model without any individual income taxes.

analytical_mtrs.long_name: Flag to use analytically derived marginal tax rates in tax functions
analytical_mtrs.description: Flag to use analytically derived marginal tax rates in tax functions

age_specific.long_name: Flag to use analytically derived marginal tax rates in tax functions
age_specific.description: Flag to use analytically derived marginal tax rates in tax functions

retirement_age.long_name: Age at which agents can collect social security benefits.
retirement_age.description: Age at which agents can collect social security benefits.

AIME_num_years.long_name: Number of years used to compute average index monthly earnings (AIME).
AIME_num_years.description: Number of years used to compute average index monthly earnings (AIME).
AIME_num_years.notes: AIME is computed using average earnings from the highest earnings years for the number of years specified here.

AIME_bkt_1.long_name: Upper bound to the first average index monthly earnings (AIME) bracket.
AIME_bkt_1.description: Upper bound to the first average index monthly earnings (AIME) bracket.

AIME_bkt_2.long_name: Upper bound to the second average index monthly earnings (AIME) bracket.
AIME_bkt_2.description: Upper bound to the second average index monthly earnings (AIME) bracket.

PIA_rate_bkt_1.long_name: The rate used to determine the primary insurance amount (PIA) in the first bracket for average index monthly earnings (AIME).
PIA_rate_bkt_1.description: The rate used to determine the primary insurance amount (PIA) in the first bracket for average index monthly earnings (AIME).

PIA_rate_bkt_2.long_name: The rate used to determine the primary insurance amount (PIA) in the second bracket for average index monthly earnings (AIME).
PIA_rate_bkt_2.description: The rate used to determine the primary insurance amount (PIA) in the second bracket for average index monthly earnings (AIME).

PIA_rate_bkt_3.long_name: The rate used to determine the primary insurance amount (PIA) in the third bracket for average index monthly earnings (AIME).
PIA_rate_bkt_3.description: The rate used to determine the primary insurance amount (PIA) in the third bracket for average index monthly earnings (AIME).

PIA_maxpayment.long_name: The maximum primary insurance amount (PIA) payment.
PIA_maxpayment.description: The maximum primary insurance amount (PIA) payment.

PIA_minpayment.long_name: The minimum primary insurance amount (PIA) payment.
PIA_minpayment.description: The minimum primary insurance amount (PIA) payment.

replacement_rate_adjust.long_name: Adjustment to the social security retirement benefits replacement rate.
replacement_rate_adjust.description: Adjustment to the social security retirement benefits replacement rate.
replacement_rate_adjust.notes: This parameter willy only vary along the time path.  It is assumed to be one in the steady state.  The steady state retirement rate can be adjusted by changing the parameters of the retirement benefits function.

budget_balance.long_name: Flag to balance government budget in each period
budget_balance.description: Flag to balance government budget in each period

baseline_spending.long_name: Flag to keep level of government spending and transfers constant between baseline and reform runs
baseline_spending.description: Flag to keep level of government spending and transfers constant between baseline and reform runs

start_year.long_name: Calendar year in which to start model analysis
start_year.description: Calendar year in which to start model analysis

tax_func_type.long_name: Functional form for individual income tax functions
tax_func_type.description: Functional form for individual income tax functions

nu.long_name: Parameter for convergence rate of functional iteration
nu.description: Parameter for convergence rate of functional iteration

maxiter.long_name: Max iterations for time path iteration
maxiter.description: Max iterations for time path iteration

mindist_SS.long_name: Tolerance for convergence of steady state solution
mindist_SS.description: Tolerance for convergence of steady state solution

mindist_TPI.long_name: Tolerance for convergence of time path solution
mindist_TPI.description: Tolerance for convergence of time path solution
